entry.title: U.S. Marshals Service assist Roseburg P.D. in fugitive apprehension effort.
entry.summary: In May of 2022, Jerry Lee Thacker, now a 57-year-old Roseburg man, was arrested on charges of Rape, Sodomy, Unlawful Sexual Penetration and Sexual Abuse. The alleged victim was a 13-year-old juvenile female and Roseburg resident. On January 9, 2024, Thacker failed to appear for trial resulting in a warrant for his arrest. The Roseburg Police Department began an investigation into Thacker’s whereabouts at that time. Using intelligence gathered during that effort, investigators came to believe Thacker fled to Knoxville, Tennessee and was living with a family member. Our agency reached out to the U.S. Marshals Service in Oregon and requested assistance in apprehending Thacker. The U.S. Marshals Service agreed to take the case and within a short period of time, located Thacker and served the warrant by taking Thacker into custody in the Knoxville, Tennessee area. Thacker was lodged at the Knox County Jail in Tennessee pending extradition. The Roseburg Police Department is very appreciative for the assistance of The U.S. Marshals Service in this case.

entry.title: GOVERNOR KOTEK RELEASES 2025-2027 BUDGET
entry.summary: December 3, 2024 3:40 a.m. On Monday, Governor Tina Kotek unveiled her 2025-2027 recommended budget entitled, Building on Progress. Kotek said, “My approach to being your Governor will always be grounded in truth, pragmatism, and a relentless pursuit of equitable outcomes for all Oregonians”. Kotek said, “The December revenue forecast projects stability for Oregon, and...

entry.title: DANIELLE HASKETT PROMOTED TO CHIEF ACADEMIC OFFICER AT UCC
entry.summary: December 3, 2024 3:30 a.m. Danielle Haskett, Dean of Academic Services for Allied Health, has been promoted to the role of Chief Academic Officer at Umpqua Community College, effective Monday, December 2nd. A college release said in the new role, Haskett will oversee a broad spectrum of initiatives across the college: Allied Health, General Education...

entry.title: DOUGLAS COUNTY MUSEUM HAS “QUILTS & CHRISTMAS” EXHIBIT
entry.summary: December 3, 2024 3:20 a.m. The Douglas County Museum has a new limited time exhibit titled, “Quilts & Christmas”. A county release said the exhibit will feature quilts, Christmas ornaments and toys from the museum’s extensive collection. The temporary exhibit is slated to run through February 2025. The quilt portion of the exhibit will...

entry.title: VETERAN TOWN HALL DECEMBER 12TH IN BROOKINGS
entry.summary: December 3, 2024 3:05 a.m. The Roseburg VA Health Care System will have a Veteran Town Hall on December 12th. It will be held at the Brookings VA Clinic on Railroad Street from 5:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m. The event will provide veterans with the opportunity to interact with VA leadership, pose questions, discover available...

entry.title: SENATORS OFFER OREGONIANS OPPORTUNITY TO REQUEST INAUGURATION TICKETS
entry.summary: December 3, 2024 2:50 a.m. Oregon’s U.S. Senators Jeff Merkley and Ron Wyden have opened the opportunity for Oregonians to request tickets to the 60th Inaugural Ceremonies on January 20, 2025. The ceremony will be at the U.S. Capitol in Washington, D.C. Each Oregonian wanting tickets may request up to four. Requestors must include their...
